website_summaries.verdict: An intense, strong espresso with a slightly burnt taste. It’s easy on the wallet, though.
pros: Brews with a fresh, bright taste, and an acceptable crema
Very dark and strong, with good intensity, yet balances well with milk or cream
Very reasonable price compared to Nespresso’s main line of coffee pods
cons: Espresso has a slightly burnt taste that some find off-putting

customer_reviews.title: Tastes Like Sadness :(
customer_reviews.text: I love Peet's. I love my Nespresso. Naturally, I expected to LOVE these. Nope! These have a very weak flavor, the capsules sounds near empty when you rattle them, and when you brew the liquid coming out goes from brown to almost clear right away. I use glass espresso cups and you can see through this liquid. Not sure how these have such great reviews? Maybe I got a bad batch? For the price tag I won't be trying again to find out. Literally the only Peet's product I haven't enjoyed. Note: To be fair, I tried a couple of capsules from each of the 4 varieties before leaving this review. All had the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: On the hunt!
customer_reviews.text: Had a meltdown in a Nespresso store over the price of pods... really! In Europe where I commute, they are half the price and its just maddening to spend that much for an espresso. Monthly, its nuts! So I have begun the hunt for a different, more reasonable and rich capsule. Peets (from whom I have had coffee for years) is right up there in the running for the ribbon; perfect fit in the machines, rich and robust and creamy head in each cup. And the price is right! Will be trying other brands over the next few weeks but of the 4 I have used so far, Peets leads!
customer_reviews.author: Kermit

customer_reviews.title: Good taste, questionable sourcing and recycling
customer_reviews.text: Bought these pods for my Nespresso Essenza. Worked well--no problems with the quality, fit, etc. HOWEVER, two things that I'd like PEET's to address here: 1) The pods are NOT recyclable. Forums state that Nespresso will discard any third party pods sent to them for recycling. Peet's really needs to come up with a program for recycling. 2) I understand the packaging says "Made in France. Distributed by Peets" or something to that effect (I threw my packaging away then found this out later through research). So is this really Peet's coffee, known and loved by many...? I'm dubious. Is this just Peet's *name* applied to a non-Peet's product?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Holme

customer_reviews.title: Description is wrong- only 10 count delivered
customer_reviews.text: Description said I would be getting 10 boxes of 10 capsules for a total of 100 count. I received one box of 10 capsules total. In a huge box. For $51. The great deal I was supposed to get turned into the most expensive espresso I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Stoll

customer_reviews.title: Really wish these had worked
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, these do not work with Nespresso original machines. I have tried it in both of mine, one is older and one is brand-new, and it's the same problem with both. The pods are just slightly too small to be punched all the way through. If you don't mind punching by hand with a small needle, I suppose it would be all right but I am returning these. It's a pity. I'm giving it 2 stars because I love Peet's Coffee and I really wish these had worked.
customer_reviews.author: Janis Ian

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: Good tasting coffee but...... It takes four capsules before the one punctures in the machine correctly. When you load the machine pods bent and don’t puncture as they should.
customer_reviews.author: unibooks

customer_reviews.title: Did not work in my Nesspresso machine
customer_reviews.text: Ended up having to get a refund because they did not work in my Nesspresso machine (original line). The purple pods just collapse without piercing the pod. So no water could pass through to brew. I'm just thankful the machine didn't break. It made a stange sound, nothing came through. So I shut it down. I tried another pod, and same thing. Then I tried the Nesspresso brand pod: everything worked fine. The other pods (not ourple) worked, but the flavor was pretty meh. I generally like Peet's, but these are a no go. And the price it's no better than Nesspresso's
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B

customer_reviews.title: Very High quality!! The taste is amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally!! A high quality coffee company that makes pods for these machines! The other alternatives are ok, but these are absolutely amazing and I'm so glad because the only high end choice was the original brand before these.
customer_reviews.author: Esther C.

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Nespresso
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to Nespresso. However, the taste is more like a regular coffee and not an espresso shot. Or it might be that I'm so used to Nespresso that it's hard to compare. Not a lot of creama either. Similarly priced. I wanted it to test it and try something other than Nespresso. Will drink it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: Beware they slipped decaffeinated in the mix
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely surprised and disappointed that they would include a decaffeinated coffee in this pack. If I am drinking espresso and buying a pack of 40 for “Peet’s” Sake (pun intended) I expect caffeinated espresso. Why would they ever slip something without caffeine in a package of expresso? It’s like drinking non alcoholic beer. Why???? Can I return the decaffeinated for something with caffeine please? Very very disappointed. Can’t stay awake to write more of my disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Nespresso and it ends up costing you more
customer_reviews.text: Paid the same price as I would for Nespresso capsules, but Nespresso tastes better and has a smoother finish. I like dark coffee and I had to use 2 capsules for 1 cup of coffee, so these are not worth it. I only need 1 Nespresso capsule per cup. I love Peet’s coffee, but only at Peet’s. Pass on these, and buy direct from Nespresso.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Giving up on Peets coffee
customer_reviews.text: Since 1988 Peet's has been my favorite coffee provider, but I'm giving it up now. No matter what type or origin of coffee I buy from them, I experience terrible gastric distress (diarrhea). Something changed 3 or 4 years ago, maybe they're blending it with ?? who knows. It is no longer the wonderful coffee it was for so long. But MUCH more expensive. I'm switching to Lavazza, results can be a bit problematic, but its 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fozzetti

customer_reviews.title: Expired items
customer_reviews.text: I would strongly recommend against ordering these unless absolutely sure is the expiration dates. I returned the first order, but the exchanged order was once again mostly expired or close to being expired (within the same month). They must have a surplus they are trying to get rid of.
customer_reviews.author: Milan Uhlir

customer_reviews.title: “No Compromise” Alternative to Nespresso brand
customer_reviews.text: I love my Originaline Nespresso machine, but I’m not crazy about the cost of Nespresso-branded capsules. And I refuse to buy any of the plastic alternatives, as I’ve tested the plastic anytime I’ve used them. There aren’t many brands other than Nespresso that use aluminum capsules, but fortunately, Peet’s does. And their coffee is great. It’s still not cheap, mind you, but definitely saves you money over the Nespresso brand; and in my opinion, Peet’s coffee is just as good, if not better than Nespresso. It’s really great that this variety pack allows you to sample four different varieties, but if you’re like me, you’ll love all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality of coffee with reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Good substitute for the original Nespresso pod with cheaper price. I always buy from the Amazon warehouse and it always gives a min of 4 or more months before it expires. Since I and my family drink a cup of it everyday, we always finish it before it expires. None of them have problems to fit in the machine, I am using the Nespresso Essenza Mini Espresso Maker. The ave price is about $0.25-0.3 per pod if buying from Amazon warehouse. The regular price of the pod is about $0.5, and it is worth it. With this taste, fit and price, no one can beat it!! Always recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Just don't buy from this site
customer_reviews.text: All boxes of pods arrived right on BEST USED BY DATE. Never had this happen before with Amazon, but... Further almost half of the first box of pods failed to work. Nespresso works, Lavazza works but not Peet. Just don't buy from this site.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley E.

customer_reviews.title: Almost as good as official nespresso pods
customer_reviews.text: I've been an avid nespresso user for a few years and I recently came across these Peet's pods. I think I may have paid $5.50 or so which is a great value considering official nespresso pods range from $7.50 to $12 for certain flavors. I thought for $5.50 why not give these a try. I did not have any expectations and was pleasantly surprised by the flavor. I think the packaging is quite intuitive as they are able to store more pods with a smaller footprint. I wouldn't say these are a replacement to the official nesspresso pods but they definitely competitive. In my particular case, these arrive a lot quicker with prime shipping than ordering from the nespresso website.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel M.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff! From a coffee snob.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big coffee drinker but not wild about Nespresso pod prices, so I'm constantly sampling other brands. The Peet's Coffee Espresso capsules are very tasty--on par with the Nespresso pods. But unfortunately they are almost as costly. My Inissia pierces the sturdy Peet's aluminum pods perfectly every time and delivers a tasty cup of cappuccino brew. I especially like the clever color coding and numbering system printed on each pod. This makes it easy when you want to sample something different during the day. Anyway, five stars for overall taste and design, three to four stars for price.
customer_reviews.author: hotdog12

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of Peet's Espresso Capsules.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Peet's Coffee when it comes to their drip coffee and I consider it the best out there! Unfortunately, I cannot say that about their Espresso capsules. Don't get me wrong, the espresso isn't terrible, but it is not the best. I find cafe liegeois is still the best Espresso capsules out there. And the price of these is more than Nespresso capsules, which I have to say, Nespresso is superior to Peet's.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Best Off-Brand Nespresso Pods I've Tried
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few off-brand pods for my Nespresso and these are by far the best! Peet's coffee is delicious, I already knew that, but these pods perform beautifully in my machine. Being aluminum, instead of plastic like other off-brands, they seem to create a perfect Nespresso coffee. They brew at the same quick rate, have an incredible amount of crema on top, they brew the correct amount each and every time and they don't leak inside my machine. (All of which have been problems for me with other brands.) I'm sold on these Peet's coffee pods. If I'm not using genuine Nespresso pods, I'm using these!
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Package has 4 strengths  Great taste. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Our Starbucks Verismo machine stopped working so we switched to a Breville Pixie. I bought these pods to see which strength we like. Brand wise I'll take Peets over Nespresso. In my opinion Peets has the best taste & quality. Surprisingly I like the #8 the best. Its very smooth, not bitter. With that said all strengths are very good. Pro's; you can recycle the aluminum pods. Good quality coffee & tastes great. Available to purchase either online or stores. The pods are color coded & numbered for strength " 8 thru 11". Con's; Pods are expensive & usually don't go on sale. If you're looking for a large mug of coffee these will not work. They're for espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Polly B

customer_reviews.title: Just as good at ~half the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of these coffee pods. They are aluminum pods just like the originals so any worry about the brewing pressure can be eliminated. My first order was the variety pack - all very good. The reorder is just their boldest blend. These go to eleven...you might say why not just make your coffee go to ten and make ten darker...you just don't understand. When other guys go to ten and you are not satisfied then reach for Peet's 11!
customer_reviews.author: Grady Donathan

customer_reviews.title: Fine coffee which works in the Nespresso machines
customer_reviews.text: Peet's is a commercially recognized nationwide coffee seller, now bundling its coffee for the Nespresso machines. These are four (4) tasty flavorful types of coffee, all good, some sweeter than others, but which meet the Nespresso production standard. This is the second time the reviewer has bought these similar types of capsules online; the first experience in buying these capsules- because of a low price - resulted in the Nespresso machine clogging up and needing a thorough cleaning. The capsules were cheap knockoffs. One has to be careful in buying these capsules; buy from a reputable company, like Peet's ; read the Amazon product reviews as the reviewers will tell you what is good and what is shoddy.
customer_reviews.author: JEDrury

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor, good seal. Body average.
customer_reviews.text: I'm from Cali. I love Peet's. The flavor of these is good. Unfortunately, the body is average. Not as rich as Nespresso. But Pressogno was my go to brand until their quality dropped to undrinkable.(wtf?) So not as watery or cheaply made as that. Good seal to the Peet's capsule. Good crema. Looks like posting pics is disabled for this product.... Hmm. So yeah...4 stars. Not 5. But I'll stick to them for now. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy of Twins

customer_reviews.title: Good until you taste Starbucks Espresso blend in a taste test
customer_reviews.text: I love Peets coffee. In fact, when in Seattle, I'll go to Peets over Starbucks. I bought both this and the Starbucks Espresso capsules for my new Nespresso Pixie machine. In a taste test, the Peets seems watery compared to the Starbucks. I thought it might be just a one off however, I tried it a few more times (making 2 separate cups and tasting them side by side) and the Starbucks wins hands down. Too bad.. I so wanted Peets to be my choice.
customer_reviews.author: CareyV

customer_reviews.title: What a Find!
customer_reviews.text: Having tried a number of Nespresso compatible capsules, all of which were not worth the money saved, now there is Peet's. These are aluminum, not cardboard capsules. They are sealed with aluminum as well. They work perfectly in my two Nespresso machines. There are now four strengths and each is equal to or better than the more expensive brand name. They are full flavored and look and taste like the original. Nespresso has slowly increased its price for capsules and they may have now priced themselves out. Try Peet's! I hope they release decaf capsules.
customer_reviews.author: A. Goldstein

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed Peet’s coffee pods for the last year. I love my Nesspresso maker but the Nesspresso brand pods can be quite expensive. I was thrilled to find Peet’s because the flavor is great and the value was even better! Unfortunately, the price is now equal to Nesspresso so I will switch to Nesspresso since there is not a price difference anymore. Not sure what caused the increase for Peet’s.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Really tasty
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it for my work coffee mug (I use a cheaper Italian, and I put skim milk in it so it doesn't matter), but during weekends I slurp on this one, any of the 4 flavors, black w/ 1/2 spoon turbinado sugar. Really yummy. I don't like sugar-free and don't care about "sophisticated coffee knower's" pretenses about whatever. I like what I like and basta and am usually right. Also, I don't give a rat's behind about that mermaid in the green circle. Way overrated and expensive in any of its installments! Italians are usually laughing their butts off when they hear about that Seattle thing. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent espresso!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is the latte drinker in the house. We bought a new espresso machine, the Nespresso Pixie Original Espresso Machine by Breville and the Nespresso 4 Milk Frother. He says it all make divine espresso and lattes with Peet's 4-espresso pods. Highly recommended! The presentation upon receipt is gorgeous in the black boxes. The only thing I would change would be to label the individual pods with the name of the espresso in addition to the intensity number. I hate referring to them as #11 or #8 or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with quality and taste
customer_reviews.text: I normally use Bestespresso capsules for my Nespresso but I was looking for a flavor change. I bought this based off of good reviews but was sadly disappointed. Perhaps it’s just my coffee preference but I found this coffee to be very bitter, and the shots pour very poorly; there is no consistency. I’ve used 3 of the different intensities so far and the shots finish pouring within 5 seconds at most and the appearance of the shots do not have the three layers that a good shot pulls. I will not be ordering these again.
customer_reviews.author: TylerandJune

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: Like most of us, I have tried to save money by buying cheaper pods. Yike. It wasn't coffee and tasted like mud water. I will not say which one was it here because they refunded my money. Very thankful. Since that experience, I was skeptical. I choose Peet's because pod was made with aluminum. It was not bad at all. It is not the same as Nespresso genuine coffee quality but I will alternate to buy peet's and nespresso . It was good. Not excellent like real nespresso coffee. But, it was good! Totally enjoyable and drinkable.
customer_reviews.author: M. H.

customer_reviews.title: 10 and 11 are ok. Anything lower and it’s weak coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to love this as a viable alternative to the Nespresso monopoly, but alas I found the flavor weak compared to the Nespresso line. I will give Peet’s credit; they are better than most alternatives out there. Peet’s 10 and 11 are drinkable as a 4 or a 5 (maybe) in the Nespresso line, but unfortunately, if you want that full bodied flavor, it’s still Nespresso for the win.
customer_reviews.author: Joliver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We have been loyal Nespresso fans for 7 years and also enjoyed Peet’s espresso when we visited their locations in the Denver area. We don’t have Peet’s in our area now, so were excited to see these pods available. They exceeded our expectations and we will keep buying them! The espresso is rich and produces a nice crema. We usually make Anericanos using a Pixie machine and enjoy stronger, darker roasts. Peet’s fits the bill!
customer_reviews.author: Teri A. Rueth

customer_reviews.title: Pete's is the ONLY non-Nespresso Brand I Buy
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my Nespresso machine and they're just as good as the Nespresso brand but much cheaper. They use the inner gas in the individual pods to keep the grounds fresh jut like Nespresso. They don't have as many flavors or varieties that Nespresso does but at least I like and use all of the flavors that Pete's includes, with Nespresso it seems like I was always left over with one or two types that I didn't care for. Other Nespresso alternatives have been disappointing in their freshness and many other ones have plastic pods which isn't as environmentally friendly. Pete's is the only non-Nespresso brand I will use.
customer_reviews.author: Madison DuPree

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee - questionable packaging
customer_reviews.text: I love Peet’s coffee and was thrilled when I discovered they were making cups for Nespresso machines. One thing I really like about Peet’s cups is the intensity number of the beans is printed on each cup so there’s no confusion. Other cups don’t include the intensity number on the individual cups. For some reason, there seems to be an issue with cups getting crushed or dented in shipping. On my last shipment, one cup was pretty severely crushed, but fortunately, I was able to fit it into the machine to use. I hope that the packaging improves because I don’t want to deal with having to return cups I can’t use.
customer_reviews.author: M&MTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Pod-tastic Peets!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Pixie espresso maker and first tried the Nespresso samples that came with it and was unimpressed. I started thinking I had paid my hard earned money fr hype. Then I tried the Peet's pods. ZING! Lahhhh! Wow. Ummm, heaven. I tried the crema scura first, then each day after tried a new one fearing that "well, it can't possibly be as good as the last one I tried." I am so glad to be wrong. Today was the last one (not last pod) Nerissimo which is ranked as a 10 so I expected bitter. No, it was smooth as Barry White. They are all wonderful, and best of all they are consistent from pod to pod.
customer_reviews.author: RJFoster

customer_reviews.title: Great but.....
customer_reviews.text: Just received my first ever Pete's Coffee for my nespresso machine. I'm using the original nespresso and wanted to try something different. Packing was very nice and secure. I'll try the flavors in the next few days and write an update. Update: coffee taste great, no complaints. Great alternative to nespresso BUT its the same price as nespresso. So I'm not sure if I'll switch. If Peet's was a bit cheaper I would definitely switch, however they are not. I'll continue with nespresso and from time to time I'll purchase Peet's.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zakrzewski

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love these but I can't even use them!
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I have purchased many brands of Nespresso pods in the past without issue. I was SO excited when these went on sale and bought two. The next day when the pods arrived, I was thrilled by beautiful, efficient, and compact packaging. I couldn't wait to try them, so I opened up a box and popped in a pod anddddddd...they don't work. The pods immediately crush when put into the machine, something that has never happened to me with other pods. They look almost identical to the Nespresso brand pods, so I think it has something to do with how flimsy the outside of these ones are. Super disappointing experience!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Crema Scura . . . .
customer_reviews.text: Just received my order this afternoon. I'm very disappointed to report this is the BEST bar none of all of the pods I've tried both Nespresso and alternatives. The reason I'm disappointed is because I was hoping to spend less. I also tried the Ristretto and liked it but found the flavor of the Crema Scura fuller, creamier and rich-rich-rich. So far my favorite Nespresso brand is the Indonesian so you have an idea of what I like for comparison. I will be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna M

customer_reviews.title: Read to find out why perfect for Nespresso machines!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried numerous other coffee capsules and this is the best! Not only is the taste good, but the water flow in the machine seems right for Nespresso. The other brands have been to slow to brew which means the coffee is packed too tight. The water flow gets his neighbor didn’t buy them coffee that is packed to tight resulting in frequent cleaning the machine. This brand is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Gr8penut

customer_reviews.title: Great Taste
customer_reviews.text: First off I really enjoy the flavors so far. The difference from 8-11 is noticeable and welcomed. The only thing I can say is that it seems that the crema(the foamy part of the espresso) lacks the density of Nespresso. That being said, I use this product to make espressos, americanos, and iced lattes and the main goal of great tasting coffee is accomplished. If I could give it 4.5 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: DCAVFB

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: Delicious and the price is right. Purchased this and didn’t realize it had a decaf box mixed in so was initially a little disappointed as we are new parents and desperately NEED caffeine. Decided to treat ourselves to a decaf espresso with dessert and now we’re hooked on that. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper Nespresso pods
customer_reviews.text: Great slightly cheaper substitute for real Nespresso pods. If you like Peet's and want to save some money, get these! Especially look out for these from Amazon warehouse when they're close to expiry. They're hermetically sealed and good long past their date
customer_reviews.author: B. Good

customer_reviews.title: The best substitute for Nespresso Livanto
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these pods. If you like the Nespresso Genova Livanto pods, these are pretty much a 1 for 1 swap. At their normal price they're not worth purchasing over the Nespresso pods, but when they go on sale for less that $7 a pack, there's no risking quality when buying these. A lot of pods like L'or and Bestpresso, etc are all cheap but don't taste ANYWHERE NEAR the quality of Nespresso. These are absolutely comparable to a Nespresso level 6 pod for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nieto

customer_reviews.title: RICH SMOOTH, YUM!
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my first package and one capsule was slightly bent, so instead of return I got a new one. Fits perfectly in my Nespresso original line. TASTE: Dark, works well with added milk foam and MCT oil dissolves nicely, BUT the flavor can NOT compare with my favorite Nespresso brand ristresso dark for amazing flavor. CREMA: Good and creamy Be careful these capsules can get bent easily and packaging is not like the stack method from Nespresso, BUT, you have to buy $35 of Nespresso capsules to get free shipping and my budget likes $7 at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Linda LeeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: As Good as or Better than Nespresso Pods (Recyclable Aluminum)
customer_reviews.text: These are the only Nespresso-style pods that meets or exceeds the Nespresso brand capsules, and I've tried a lot, including Bestpresso, Hiline, and others, all in many varieties. The coffee is fabulous - better than I remember Peet's being, and the capsule performance greatly exceeds any other knock-off pods - no misfires, and always good flow. And these are aluminum. Given their quality and performance, combined with the price point being the same as Nespresso, I wonder if these might be made by the same people people. Next time, I will probably buy these over anything else.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Taste great, bad failure rate
customer_reviews.text: The taste of the espresso is very good. My favorite across all the 3rd party nespresso pods I have tasted. The problem is with the design. For some reason, these things fail on me. Not even the cheap ones do this. The machine struggles to produce drops and then gives up. I open it up and see the pod has basically imploded and is unusable. Not sure how many others see this problem, but it immediately shoots up the price of successful cups of espresso. I have seen this when I have gotten them from the grocery store, as well as Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: matthew armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Good Price for very Good Coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Never particularly liked the only coffee pods available and was very happily surprised when Peet's had their's available. I was not disappointed. Strong enough to really be espresso and with a good taste with the strongest varieties in the sample package. I have lived in Italy and enjoy good coffee, and I enjoy Peet's.
customer_reviews.author: Colorist

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit Nespresso machine properly
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit properly apparently even though they are aluminum pods. I was very sad when I saw the water coming out of my machine, which does not drip at all with original Nespresso pods. I will stick with original Nespresso in future. I was given a "refund".
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Sacks

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee, bad recycling program.
customer_reviews.text: Got these at a discount from Amazon but one box was about to get expired too soon, I still used it before it was too much of a hassle returning these. Nespresso originals do not have expiry date anyway. This coffee is almost great as Nespresso original and come in aluminum pods unlike cheap plastics. They're recyclables but the big disappointment I learn was that Nespresso won't take these for their recycling program. Come on Peet's, now I gotta go to two different recycling programs? Just work something out with Nespresso!
customer_reviews.author: Naveed

customer_reviews.title: weak coffee I BELIEVE DUE TO LESS EXPRESSO
customer_reviews.text: This coffee is obviously diluted with less expresso.....I need 2 or three to keep me awake. Something changed and I will not ever order it again. What a joke to us who enjoy a good cup of expresso.....back to my old brand, even if I pay more at leasT I get the real deal...BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sells

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t compare to the original
customer_reviews.text: This coffee isn’t comparable to Nespresso. The coffee is bitter and the pods stick in the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Patobi

customer_reviews.title: My New Go To Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: As good and possibly better than Nespresso! These capsules work, unlike all the other Nespresso alternatives. The coffee is delicious. Bold and flavorful as it should be. The price is a little less than Nespresso as well. Note: Bear in mind that Peet's is known for rich strong coffee. If you like Folgers, you may be in for an eye opening experience. Pun intended.... Update, I am now back to Nespresso capsules as Peets has gotten too big for their britches and raised the price too high.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Gecko

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Damn Good!
customer_reviews.text: This variety pack delivers. It delivers flavor. Bold beautiful flavor. No weak lame watered out decaf or #3 intensity garbage. I have noted others making the remark about being 2 cents more..... Okay but I did not get twenty capsules that were like drinking water. You do the math on twenty caps that ate in the variety pack of many companies. I am not going to worry about the recycling aspect as I might just reload these. Otherwise I can put them in the Nespresso bag.
customer_reviews.author: michael steinrok

customer_reviews.title: It tastes and smells like proper coffee, not a watered down resemblance
customer_reviews.text: Peets it good coffee, the flavor is full and the bouquet is rich. Most non-branded Nespresso capsules are weak, these in my opinion are batter (and cheaper) than the Nespresso branded capsules. I use these and the Verona Bestpresso capsules. As well as regular filter coffee, to keep things mixed up. The big advantage of filter is you can make it strong when you want strong coffee, it just takes a little longer. Peets and Bestpresso delivers consistency, but sometimes its just not strong enough.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Quayle

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative! Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: my whole family loves coffee, so my Nespresso capsules always run out. I was in search of good alternatives and Peet’s meets my standard! They came in beautiful packaging and I love how the capsules are kept this way and not dented! Most importantly, the coffee tastes good! I still love nespresso better with a wide variety of flavors, but Peet’s is good enough, now I can take turns on using different capsules. This is a budget savor without sacrificing the taste!
customer_reviews.author: kt

customer_reviews.title: not the flavor I expected
customer_reviews.text: If you love coffee STRONG then this is for you, otherwise it is not. I bought this to use at our Nespresso machine at work but I did not like the flavor. I tried adding milk but it just tastes TOO strong. Other people in the office love it and drink it without milk or sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Luvblue21

customer_reviews.title: I love Peet’s, but these capsules were disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I used to drink a lot of Peet’s drip coffee before I got the nespresso machine, so I thought I’d give these Peet’s capsules a try. They’re aluminum, which is excellent - nobody wants a dose of plastic in the morning. However, the coffee itself is very watery. Bleh. There are better products for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Simeon S.

customer_reviews.title: Peet’s is good! (If under 40 cents a capsule, then great!)
customer_reviews.text: Peet’s is the best Nespresso alternative. I especially love when I get a good sale on Amazon Warehouse deals. The quality of the capsules is as good as Nespresso, but the flavor and foam are better with Nespresso. The aroma of coffee is amazing. I like that that the coffee is still intense, yet decaf. For me it’s all about the price point. If I can get these under 40 cents a capsule, it’s worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Watery flavor - if I wanted Keurig tasted I would have bought a Keurig
customer_reviews.text: This literally tastes watery. I got these to try as an alternative to the regular Nespresso pods as they were all that could be delivered same day by Amazon. Glad I was able to get same day delivery but won't be buying this product again - stick to the regular Nespresso pods for a richer flavor
customer_reviews.author: AmazinReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Coffee for Nespresso
customer_reviews.text: This is my absolute favorite coffee for Nespresso use. Although I drink regular coffee in the morning, this is a must-have for me in the afternoon and evening. I'm addicted to the brand and flavor although their espresso tastes very good, too. I drink coffee black so taste is paramount. The Nespresso capsules do not taste good to me, definitely not full bodied like Peets. That's just my opinion. I'm so glad I gave Peet's a try.
customer_reviews.author: SaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many off brands for my Nespresso, trying to save a buck, and I would always end up super disappointed and go right back to the original brand.... until I discovered this. I think what it actually comes down to is that it's made out of aluminum and that's what actually makes it taste better and more similar to the Nespresso brand. BUT, even that's the case it does taste great and it's less expensive than Nespresso. I'm hooked!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Rose Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent almost expired products
customer_reviews.text: I tried these from a local grocery store, so I decided to order them on amazon because they were cheaper. The boxes that arrived were all expiring in August 2019, so less than 1 1/2 months from now. I’ve also noticed when using these in my nespresso inissia, they leave some small grounds behind. The taste is good, but it’s not sealed as well as the nespresso brand. I’ve also read they contain less caffeine than the nespresso ones. I will use them for iced lattes but stick to nespresso kazaar for straight up.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Come for the coffee, stay for the amazing people who make it.
customer_reviews.text: I love Peet's. I had the pleasure of talking to the customer service due to my own error and they fixed the problem not only quickly, but above and beyond my wildest expectations. Oh, and their coffee is delicious and comes out perfect every time. Go ahead and buy them. You won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative to Nespresso
customer_reviews.text: Peets capsules is one of the better coffee out there to be used on the original Nespresso maker. Fully contain in aluminum, the coffee remains fresh and tasty. Not water down like other brands. Just like Nespresso, Peets also offer free recycling with their's coffee capsules, via prepaid label from their website. Been using Peets for my espresso fix several years now.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to the Nespresso capsules
customer_reviews.text: I'll start this with saying that you should give these a chance. For the price, the taste, and the convenience of ordering through Amazon, it's worth it. Is it as good as the original Nespresso capsules? No, but it's not too far off, hence the docking of a star. The originals taste better and produce a richer crema but these are decent substitute for less than the originals cost. If anything, these are great to have out for your guests so you can keep your own stash from depleting. :)
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Recommend these pods
customer_reviews.text: We use these pods in our nespresso automatic coffee maker. I’ve tried other odd from other retailers but they all taste stale or lack the espresso flavor. This is the only brand that tastes closest to an actual coffee house espresso. I have these on monthly subscription. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: QualityoverQuantity

customer_reviews.title: 100 count is an unbeatable value
customer_reviews.text: At 50 cents per pod, this is pretty unbeatable for Peet's, which are the closest performing competitor to Nespresso's own offerings. I don't find the Peet's versions as good, but they are close, and they don't fall through the machine or act weird. I find this Peet's 9 is closer to a Nespresso 10, as the Peet's Ristretto 10 is bitter to me and more like a Nespresso 11.
customer_reviews.author: dub

customer_reviews.title: More expensive than real Nespresso brand but also better
customer_reviews.text: These are an odd product in that it's an off-brand alternative that's more expensive than the OEM version sold by Nespresso. However, I do like these Peets ones better. The cost is just too high though because one or even two a day is not really enough. If you're willing to spend a lot on pods or don't drink a ton, then I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: CMc

customer_reviews.title: They are cheap made
customer_reviews.text: They don’t work in my nespresso machine. The look just like the other pods I have purchased but they do not work. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRICE BUT EXPIRES IN TWO WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PRICE BUT EXPIRES IN TWO WEEKS. So here’s the deal, the value is great but the pods expire in two weeks. love, love, love the peet espresso pods they taste great and are smooth in flavor. The only issue is that the expire in two weeks. Yes, you can drink after “expired” but it’s kinda ridiculous that they have expiration date of two weeks out. So here’s the deal great price and flavor but be aware that they expire in two weeks upon delivery. So 5 for value and flavor and 1 star because they are about to expire!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, quality packaging hides almost tasteless coffee...
customer_reviews.text: I really, really, REALLY wanted to like these pods: from the glowing reviews on Reddit and here on Amazon, to the beautiful capsules and overall excellent packaging, I expected to be equally impressed with the quality of the espresso; not so. Unlike the Nespresso-brand and Starbucks-branded capsules, I found the espresso made with my Peet’s capsules to be exceedingly bland — almost tasteless, in fact. It’s clear that Peet’s is a brand that cares about their product, but they just didn’t nail the flavor with these... Too bad, because the price is VERY reasonable! Looks like I will be returning to Nespresso/Starbucks, after all...
customer_reviews.author: L. Sconzo

customer_reviews.title: magnificent coffee for its price
customer_reviews.text: I had original Espresso pod once. They are good and also pricey. It's 70 cents a pod. I like double shots which adds up. I am glad I find this perfect alternative because you can buy amazon warehouse item for 30 cents per pod. It's steal and takes magnificently.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like an ashtray compared to Nespresso
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy Nespresso Ristretto but saw these and thought why not give it a try. These taste so blah in comparison. The initial flavor tastes burned like adding cigarette ashes to your coffee. And the aftertaste is really bitter. Not a fan. I’d totally go for these if the flavor was even 75% as good as Nespresso because of the cost savings, but like the old adage says: “you get what you pay for”. I’m sticking with Nespresso.
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great, no leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried a lot of non-Neapresso brand pods, and these are by far some of my favorites. The flavor is amazing (especially a fan of the Ristretto), the espresso tastes fresh, and most importantly these seat properly in my DeLonghi Pixie machine to give a proper pull! I was having a lot of issues with the plastic pods not getting a good seal and resulting in a very watery shot. Very happy with these! Currently looking into whether Nespresso will accept these for their in house recycling program, which would make these even better IMO.
customer_reviews.author: NurseMama

customer_reviews.title: Defective capsules
customer_reviews.text: Although my return window closed July 12, I just started opening these and found to my dismay, that the majority of the capsules were damaged and had no coffee in them, and didn't work . Note the capsules on the LEFT ARE SMASHED, ... about 25% were fine ( capsules on RIGHT. I have purchased this product in stores and had no issues. Disappointed at the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Smooth coffee with a fair amount of crema. Ultimately, this taste is weak...I find I have to use three capsules to get the "8 intensity" that I'm looking for. Since the price is around the same as the Nespresso brand, just buy Nespresso's. Or, if you are looking for less expensive espresso pods that still result in rich, strong espresso, buy Pressogno brand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: First impression  .IMPRESSIVE !
customer_reviews.text: I am a Nespresso addict. I've tried spin offs and always go back to the original. Peet's packaging is beautiful, looks like a box of chocolates. Beautiful and functional as well. I love how the Peet's capsules have the intensity on the pod. With Nespresso I mark each pod with a marker between 8 -12 are my favorites. My first cup was WOW, great way to start the day. The pods work well in my machine, no issues so far. Will purchase again. Oh and I ordered and received the next day. Fantastic company and product. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: CCN2

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: My friend sold me his Nespresso machine and gave me a couple of these pods with it and I was hooked from the first drink I made. My favorite has got to be the Crema Scura - intensity level 9. Its creamy. It smells amazing. Definitely going to order another box as I am going through them fairly quickly. I use two pods to make my drinks in the morning for work. I normally go to Starbucks but this saves me money and time! With 40 pods, I’ll get 20 drinks or more if I make a drink in a smaller cup. Definitely worth the buy. F
customer_reviews.author: Reuben Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Nespresso Brand. Still good.
customer_reviews.text: They are the ugly sister to Nespresso. They aren't bad. They are better than many other brands. However the price is barley better than Nespresso. I should say I enjoyed them. But they aren't as good. Just buy the real deal. But if you insist on buying a cheaper alternative these are the best alternative to Nespresso brand I've found. And I've tried a few.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative. They fit machines. Favorite choice for dark espresso pods
customer_reviews.text: These pods fit espresso machines well. No sticking. The coffee quality is comparable to the best. A better choice than 95% of the brands out there. Less expensive than the nespre55o and starbux but comparable taste, quality and performance. Note: We were not compensated in any way for this unbiased review. No one should be.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Rich taste and thick crema
customer_reviews.text: Of the various non-Nepresso pods that I have tried, the Peet's brand is the best in my view. It produces a bold flavor with rich crema on the top. I like Peet's ground coffee when I had a drip machine, and the Nepresso capsules are miles above that in taste. The price is also less than the Nepresso capsules. I like to try new, but Peet's is one of my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: kmrotterdam

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand and have often bought the Kcup version for full coffee cup, 6 oz or more. Thought I’d try it for my Nespresso machine and am largely pleased but Nespresso brand capsules set the bar unattainably high for the competition, as such a 4 star rating is as good as it gets outside Nespresso brand. Will continue to buy and keep in the variety rotation. It is important for me that the capsules are all aluminum and not a cheap plastic alternative. These capsules fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: CWW

customer_reviews.title: Bitter
customer_reviews.text: I'm not familiar with this Brand and see it at the SM. The espresso pods are of good quality but the taste of the coffee was extremely bitter. Not enough sugar to cover it up. Maybe it would taste better with foamed milk or a creamer but alone I was disappointed. I would rather spend the extra money on one of the Italian or Hispanic brands.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Best Nespresso!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after buying a couple other brands, including Starbucks. I was so impressed with this coffee! It tastes so great and smells so wonderful! It doesn't need much milk or honey because the taste is so good. I first purchased just one box, but now buy the packs of five because they are so good and the deal for more is so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenalee Paige

customer_reviews.title: residual liquid
customer_reviews.text: I like Peet's. Correct me if I am wrong....but I believe that these capsules are not constructed exactly like the Original Nespresso. They're probably of a thicker foil because my Expert machine ends up with a huge amount of residual water in the 'catch'. A couple of shots and it's almost full, needs to be emptied. The machine is not built to pierce the build of these Peet's original capsules. Therefore, water spills out and the espresso product is limited to smaller drink amounts.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: As good as Nespresso
customer_reviews.text: These taste as good and are as convenient as Nespresso with the same cost. I like the fact that their intensity is given on the capsule. Not as many options as Nespresso and no flavored coffees as far as I can tell. Decaf a bit hard to find but available. Easy ordering. As a sometime (often visitor to the Bay Area I like to support Peets over that other place.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Delicious espresso or iced coffee at home
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these about once a month for the past 6 months. They are great and seem like a good value. I have noticed they fluctuate in price a bit, which can be a bummer. I love peets coffee, and this product is no different. Definitely a Peets fan! My favorite way to use them is make an espresso, then serve it over ice with cream. My homemade ice coffee. Cheaper than going our for coffee all the time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cheek

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work in Nespresso machine.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work in my nespresso machine. I tried 6 and 3 out of 6 failed. I'm Not too happy about it. I Was hoping they'd work. I literally have to slam the machine shut while trying to hold the pod in the correct place in the machine. The machine doesn't puncture the cups. A bit over packaged too. Flavor is good when they work.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Poppins

customer_reviews.title: Identical to Nespresso pods
customer_reviews.text: Finally! After trying about 10 different makes of 'Nespresso-like' pods, these Peets ones are perfect! They're exactly like the real Nespresso pods. They fit exactly right in the machine, coffee comes out exactly as it should, and they taste strong and flavorful. The search is over. Every make I've tried so far has not fit the machine correctly and been super weak and flavorless, but these are awesome. Very happy with the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pillowtalk

customer_reviews.title: Not great, not bad
customer_reviews.text: Around here, Peet's Coffee has a very good reputation. However, I have a Nespresso Touch and the quality of Peet's comparable flavors, such as Ristretto, do not satisfy my tastes. Peet's Ristretto is probably the best of the lot for me. But there is nothing that quite matches the true flavor of Nespresso Fortissio, for example, or even Arpeggio. If you're looking for something cheaper than Nespresso, this should do it. To each his own taste.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great taste.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite Nespresso pods (Dharkan) is being discounted. I chose Peet's 11 as a replacement. Side by side taste test at showed they were very similar in taste. This will be my new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative
customer_reviews.text: Amazing coffee with great crema! Works really well with my Nespresso lattissima pro. They have this at Target. Although, I don't understand why they cost as much as the actual Nespresso line. I believe they should be a bit cheAper bc it's a chain.
customer_reviews.author: bobby jo

customer_reviews.title: Overkill on Packing
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine, I used it for drinking coffee, and I have only one complaint about the box that they had shipped out the product. Over 12 feet of packing air pillows in a extremely oversized box for one tiny 3 ounce box roughly the size of a cellphone. The waste left me regretting my purchase and it was just not right
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but subscribe & save is a rip-off
customer_reviews.text: These Nespresso compatible pods are excellent. I tried and decided to use amzn subscribe and save. They bumped price by $5 and didn’t even inform. At this higher price its more that originals so not worth it. Peets Coffee is 5 star, Amazon Subscribe and Save 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: L. MINICK

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to original pods.
customer_reviews.text: We've owned original Nespresso machines for 11 years - and was excited to see another option for pods. I can even buy these from our local store (with the Red bullseye). They don't seem to 'stress' the machine like other plastic-capsule brands do. Flavor and crema are great!
customer_reviews.author: MNTraveler

customer_reviews.title: love my Peets coffee
customer_reviews.text: This variety pack is awesome! I love the variety of different intensities of Peet's coffee. I like my coffee on the stronger side and my family likes theirs on the milder side so this is perfect for us. I've been going to Peet's for years since my college days and have loved the taste of their coffee for a long time. Would repurchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Cecelia

customer_reviews.title: Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The coffee is good, what you expect a nice variety and all are tasty. But a gripe on the packaging: These things are packaged in almost like gift boxes, with lots of extra stuff to cut and open to get to the capsules. And not even very resealable. Not frustration-free.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN D RILEY

customer_reviews.title: If you like weak boring flavor then buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I tried these because I’ve enjoyed Peet’s drip coffee in the past. Rating system is 8 to 11 with 11 being the most robust. 11 barely has any flavor, which means the 8 is bland garbage. If you like weak espresso then these are for you. I’ll be going back to Nespeesso.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Have tried almost ALL off brands....
customer_reviews.text: Have tried just about every “off” brand of Nespresso pods. Peet’s is the first one that I actually like! We drink several espressos every day. I drink mine as straight shots, so taste is important to me. Peet’s is smooth, strong and tastes like something you’d get in Europe. No issues with smashed up pods. They fit the Nespresso machine perfect. And the smell is heavenly. Will be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: KD Roach

product_meta.title: Peet's Coffee Espresso Capsules Variety Pack, 40 Count Single Cup Coffee Pods, Compatible with Nespresso Original Brewers, Crema Scura, Nerissimo, Ricchezza, Ristretto
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Variety Pack| Size:10 Count (Pack of 4)Intense espresso enthusiasts, this is for you. Now you can delve into a deeper kind of dark, with every nuance and complex note of Peet's signature dark espresso now available in a convenient capsule.
feature_bullets: Explore 4 of our dark, rich espresso blends: Nerissimo, Ristretto, Crema Scura, & Ricchezza. This sampler pack contains a 10-count carton of each of our single cup coffee pod varieties

COMPATIBLE WITH THE NESPRESSO ORIGINAL*: The boldness of Peet’s signature dark espresso is available in a convenient capsule designed to fit your Nespresso Original* machine (Essenza Mini, Essenza Plus, Pixie, CitiZ, Lattissima, KitchenAid, Creatista

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
